meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a brat.
meanings.sent1: The child's brattish behavior upset the other kids at the playground.
meanings.sent2: She displayed a brattish attitude when she didn't get her way.
meanings.sent3: The brattish puppy chewed up all the shoes in the house!
meanings.sent4: Her brattish demands made her difficult to work with.
meanings.sent5: The brattish cat knocked over the vase in a fit of anger.

meanings.definition: Behaving like a spoiled or badly behaved child.
meanings.sent1: His brattish tantrum in the store embarrassed his parents.
meanings.sent2: The brattish student refused to listen to the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The brattish prince threw a fit when he didn't get the dessert he wanted.
meanings.sent4: Her brattish behavior made it hard for others to enjoy the party.
meanings.sent5: The brattish toddler screamed and kicked in the grocery store.
